channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: WHO says no evidence shows that having coronavirus prevents a second infection
item.description: The World Health Organization is warning that people who have had Covid-19 are not necessarily immune by the presence of antibodies from getting the virus again.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Latest news from around the world
Trump leaves coronavirus briefing without answering questions
item.description: President Trump unexpectedly leaves the coronavirus task force briefing without answering questions, a day after he asked medical experts to look into the possibility of injecting disinfectant as a treatment for the coronavirus.

item.title: Trump derails his own briefing
What happened on board the last cruise ship still at sea
item.description: In January 2020, the gigantic Costa Deliziosa cruise ship slipped its moorings in the Italian city of Venice and headed out into the Adriatic Sea on an around-the-world voyage. Around 2000 passengers were on board for what they hoped would be the trip of a lifetime.

item.title: Singapore's migrant workers are suffering the brunt of the country's coronavirus outbreak
Trump administration points finger at China for attempts to steal coronavirus research
item.description: The Trump administration is pointing the finger at China for attempting to steal coronavirus research as officials are warning they have seen a growing wave of cyberattacks on US government agencies and medical institutions leading the pandemic response by nation states and criminal groups.

item.title: In Pakistan's fight against Covid-19, religion might not be helping
item.description: Pakistan is entering its fifth week under lockdown to control the spread of the coronavirus. But as the Islamic holy month of Ramadan starts this weekend, hundreds of thousands of people will congregate in mosques nationwide to offer special prayers.

item.title: Watch the entire CNN/Sesame Street coronavirus town hall
item.description: CNN's Erica Hill and Dr. Sanjay Gupta partner with Sesame Street to explain the ABC's of coronavirus in a town hall for parents and kids. Watch the full event below.

item.title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta shuts down Trump's medical claim
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta and Anderson Cooper talk to Dr. Leana Wen about President Trump's comments regarding the use of ultraviolet light or injections of disinfectant to try to kill coronavirus

item.title: For the first time in 16 years, the US Air Force has no heavy bombers on Guam
Must-watch videos of the week
Navy recommends reinstating commander of USS Theodore Roosevelt
Kanye West is finally a billionaire, Forbes says. He sent a text to say it undervalued him
item.description: Kanye West has long coveted the title of "billionaire."

item.title: Million-dollar whisky sale targeted in cyber attack, says auctioneer
item.description: The second phase of a million-dollar online whisky auction has been postponed after it became the target of a cyber attack, auctioneers have said.

item.title: How to tell if your pet is stressed and what you can do about it
item.description: Happy dogs chasing balls on their fourth walk of the day. Purring puffs of fluff who can't wait to snuggle with pet parents miraculously home all day. These are the images we may have of sheltering with our pets during the age of coronavirus.

item.title: To get around stay-at-home orders, Spaniards have been walking some unusual 'pets'
item.description: The Spanish government's strict stay-at-home order allows people to leave their homes to walk their pets.

item.title: To my son, born in the time of coronavirus and climate change
item.description: My dearest River,

item.title: Mental health is 'a pandemic no one is talking about,' says NBA All-Star
item.description: NBA star Kevin Love keeps a Shakespeare quote in his notebook: "Things won are done, joy's soul lies in the doing."

item.title: What will it take to reopen the economy in a safe way?
item.description: CNN's Tom Foreman highlights the steps needed to help reopen the US economy safely amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: New Zealand PM marks Anzac Day -- from her driveway
item.description: It's Anzac Day in New Zealand and Australia -- but people have to mark the day of remembrance a little differently this year, even prime ministers.

item.title: NASA team develops a ventilator specifically tailored to coronavirus patients
Rugby is in 'crisis' but this man thinks he can solve it
item.description: A plucky, abrasive presence on the rugby field, Agustin Pichot has never done things quietly -- a boldness he now carries into the game's boardrooms.

item.title: See how far spit droplets travel through air when we talk
item.description: The CDC recommends that all Americans wear face coverings in public. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains why wearing them in addition to physical distancing is so important.

item.title: 'The sea is stormy and the captain is dancing on the deck.' One view of the US from Italy
item.description: For months, Italy has had the most coronavirus-related deaths of any country in the world, and Cremona, a province in Italy's north, has been particularly hard hit. Beppe Severgnini, a veteran Italian journalist and author, lives in the provincial capital, Crema, where he says he has become accustomed to the sound of ambulance sirens, almost as if he lived in New York.

item.title: We nixed our wedding to protect our friends and then they surprised us with one
item.description: We were boyfriends for four years. Every anniversary was a party. The engagement was epic, complete with an Instagram-worthy surprise proposal against the Los Angeles skyline. Best of all, Kartik said yes.

item.title: We're in a golden age of TV re-runs. Soon it might be all we have
item.description: Nick Offerman never knew he was part of a TV juggernaut.

item.title: Meghan and Harry to dial into London court hearing in lawsuit against tabloids
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex will dial in to a London court hearing on Friday ahead of Meghan's lawsuit against Associated Newspapers, according to a royal source.

item.title: As Lonely Planet closes its offices, a look back at the brand's early days
item.description: The recent news that Lonely Planet Publications was shutting down its production offices in Melbourne and London almost entirely, and totally eliminating its widely admired magazine and all non-guidebook titles, didn't take me completely by surprise.

item.title: John Oliver takes aim at Fox News coronavirus coverage
item.description: John Oliver takes a deep dive into conservative media pushing misinformation about the coronavirus on "HBO's Last Week Tonight."

item.title: Pandemic extends Liverpool's agony after 30-year hiatus
Michelle Obama for VP in 2020?
item.description: Former First Lady Michelle Obama has repeatedly said she is not running for office, but now that Democratic nominee and former VP Joe Biden has vowed to choose a female VP, could she reconsider? Chris Cillizza explains why Michelle Obama would be a dream vice president pick, but why it's unlikely to happen.

item.title: Indonesia has the world's biggest Muslim population. It just banned holiday travel over Ramadan
item.description: Indonesia has temporarily banned domestic road, air and sea travel starting Friday to prevent the spread of coronavirus, as millions of Muslims mark the start of the holy month of Ramadan.

item.title: Alicia Keys debuts powerful new song
item.description: Alicia Keys, a 15-time Grammy winner, debuts "Good Job" during a CNN global town hall addressing the latest developments in the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: 'Songs for great leaders': The music of North Korea
item.description: "So dear to all our hearts is our General's glorious name; our own beloved Kim Il Sung of undying fame," go the lyrics to one of North Korea's best-known songs, "Song of General Kim Il Sung," which honors the country's founding ruler and eternal president.

item.title: Taylor Swift slams former record label for releasing new album
item.description: The longtime feud between Taylor Swift and her former record label has been reignited.

item.title: Massive 'ice shoves' threaten lakeside homes
item.description: See 30-foot-tall ice walls, also known as "ice shoves," move into lakeside homes in Minnesota. Warm weather has caused the ice on the lake to thaw causing ice waves to slowly crash into homes on the shore.

item.title: What traveling in 'economy class' could look like after virus
item.description: It's clear flying will be different after coronavirus, and while some airlines are discussing the removal of middle seats to maintain social distancing, one airplane interiors company has come up with concepts for adapting economy class cabins.

item.title: Hubble Space Telescope celebrates 30 years of discoveries and awe-inspiring images
item.description: The Hubble Space Telescope launched 30 years ago on Friday, forever changing the way we see the universe. The telescope's ethereal, dreamy and almost fantasy-like views of space vistas have inspired people for decades and led to some of the most important astronomical discoveries.

item.title: These otherworldly photographs warn of Iceland's disappearing rivers
item.description: The first time photographer Chris Burkard encountered the desolate beauty of Iceland, it took his breath away.

item.title: Beauty YouTuber Patrick Starrr: 'Makeup has no gender and shouldn't have one'
item.description: Growing up, I was drawn to stories of transformation. I loved America's Next Top Model and films like Cinderella and The Princess Diaries, which all center on metamorphosis through beauty.

item.title: This nutritionist is keeping schoolkids fed -- even during lockdown
item.description: The coronavirus crisis has forced schools in Kenya to close, but Wawira Njiru believes this is no reason for children to go hungry.

item.title: Bars collect money from walls for laid-off employees
item.description: Bars peel dollar bills off walls and ceilings to pay laid-off workers. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: China reveals name of Mars mission, which will take place in 'coming months'
item.description: China's space agency revealed the name of its first Mars exploration mission on Friday, and said the mission is on track to take place "in the coming months."

item.title: How a media-distracted Trump derailed his own briefing
More than 20,000 people have died in the UK from coronavirus
Watch Dr. Birx's reaction to Trump's dangerous suggestion
item.description: President Trump asked William Bryan, head of science and technology for DHS, to study UV light and dangerously injecting disinfectant to treat coronavirus. Medical experts agree that sunlight and disinfectant are not safe human treatments for coronavirus.

item.title: US deaths top 52,000, over a quarter of global toll
item.description: Less than three months since the first known coronavirus death in the US, the country's fatalities make up more than quarter of the global death toll.

item.title: Trump lies that he was being 'sarcastic' on disinfectant claim
item.description: Tracking US cases | Podcast | Catch up | Q&A | Life after lockdown

item.title: White House official tries to move CNN reporter at briefing
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta discusses why President Trump ended the coronavirus briefing without taking questions and how a White House official tried to move a CNN reporter to the back of the room.
